message.content:
We “build” the AR balance from all transactions that changed accounts receivable. In our system only “Sale” transactions that use the “Account Receviable” receive method (that is, sales not immediately collected as cash) add to receivables. For example, if the company begins with no receivables, each sale done on‐account increases AR by the “after_tax_amount” of that sale. (Any sale that is settled by cash does not affect AR.) In our file we must go line‐by‐line and “add” (increase) the AR for every sale whose “receive_method” equals “Account Receviable.”

A brief outline of the arithmetic is as follows (all amounts in the same monetary unit):

• Sale20240103004 – increase by 2,567.59  
• Sale20240104005 – +2,629.20 → running total 5,196.79  
• Sale20240105007 – +1,928.32 → 7,125.11  
• Sale20240106009 – +178,393.06 → 185,518.17  
• Sale20240106010 – +233,715.76 → 419,233.93  
• Sale20240108014 – +2,798.45 → 422,032.38  
• Sale20240109016 – +12,329.71 → 434,362.09  
• Sale20240109017 – +42,758.32 → 477,120.41  
• Sale20240109018 – +13,528.83 → 490,649.24

• Sale20240111022 – +49,852.99 → 648,047.44  
• Sale20240113025 – +231,250.05 → 879,297.49  
• Sale20240113026 – +54,037.80 → 933,335.29

• Sale20240116032 – +226,467.42 → 1,164,589.12

• Sale20240118037 – +45,095.21 → 1,388,881.02  
• Sale20240119040 – +51,296.37 → 1,440,177.39  
• Sale20240122046 – +2,074.55 → 1,442,251.94  
• Sale20240122047 – +223,935.33 → 1,666,187.27  
• Sale20240123048 – +35,271.22 → 1,701,458.49  
• Sale20240125050 – +178,862.46 → 1,880,320.95  
• Sale20240125051 – +208,980.21 → 2,089,301.16  
• Sale20240127055 – +36,428.18 → 2,125,729.34  
• Sale20240127056 – +247,105.16 → 2,372,834.50  
• Sale20240127057 – +13,864.84 → 2,386,699.34  
• Sale20240129060 – +9,387.99 → 2,396,087.33

• Sale20240203065 – +53,607.07 → 2,743,198.22  
• Sale20240204068 – +13,908.31 → 2,757,106.53  
• Sale20240205070 – +8,949.59 → 2,766,056.12  
• Sale20240205071 – +224,003.73 → 2,990,059.85  
• Sale20240205072 – +1,812.12 → 2,991,871.97  

This final “on‐account” total is 2,991,871.97. In the cash flow statement an increase in AR means cash “used” (a decrease in cash flows), so the "(Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable" is reported as a negative number.

Thus the final answer is:

{
  "(Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable": "-2991871.97"
}
